intro: Gypsocallis leucanthera, commonly known as the white-flowered gypsocallis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking white petals and sturdy, erect stems. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments and produces showy inflorescences during the warmer months. Its foliage consists of broad, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
